flounder.loaders

Class FlounderLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.loaders.FlounderLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IModule

    public class FlounderLoader
extends java.lang.Object
implements IModule
    Contains a lot of methods for VAO and VBO data management, and also keeps track of all currently active VAOs and VBOs.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FlounderLoader()
      Creates a new OpenGL loader class.

      • createVAO

        public int createVAO()
        Creates an empty VAO.
        Returns:
        The ID of the VAO.

      • createInterleavedVAO

        public int createInterleavedVAO(float[] data,
                                int... lengths)
        Loads interleaved vertex data into a VBO which is stored in a newly created VAO (without index buffer).
        Parameters:
        data - The vertex data.
        lengths - The length (number of floats) of each data element. E.g. Data for positions, normals and texture coords may have lengths of 3, 3, 2.
        Returns:
        The ID of the new VAO.

      • createInterleavedVAO

        public int createInterleavedVAO(int vertexCount,
                                float[]... data)
        Creates a VAO, interleaves the data, and stores it in the VAO. No index buffer is associated with the VAO.
        Parameters:
        vertexCount - The number of vertices whose data is being stored.
        data - The various sets of data (positions, normals, texture coords, etc.)
        Returns:
        The newly created VAO.

      • createInterleavedVAO

        public int createInterleavedVAO(float[] interleavedData,
                                int[] indices,
                                int... lengths)
        Loads interleaved vertex data into a VBO which is stored in a newly created VAO (with index buffer).
        Parameters:
        interleavedData - Vertex data.
        indices - Index buffer data.
        lengths - The lengths of each data element.
        Returns:
        The ID of the new VAO.

      • storeInterleavedDataInVAO

        public void storeInterleavedDataInVAO(int vaoID,
                                      float[] data,
                                      int... lengths)
        Stores interleaved data into a VAO.
        Parameters:
        vaoID - The ID of the VAO.
        data - The interleaved float data.
        lengths - The lengths in floats of each of the data elements associated with any given vertex.

      • deleteVAOFromCache

        public void deleteVAOFromCache(int vao)
        Deletes a VAO from memory along with any associated VBOs.
        Parameters:
        vao - The vao to be deleted.

      • createEmptyVBO

        public int createEmptyVBO(int floatCount)
        Creates a new VBO with no data.
        Parameters:
        floatCount - The number of floats to be allotted.
        Returns:
        The new buffer objects ID.

      • createIndicesVBO

        public int createIndicesVBO(int vaoID,
                            int[] indices)
        Creates an index buffer and binds it to a VAO.
        Parameters:
        vaoID - The ID of the VAO to which the index buffer should be bound.
        indices - The array of indices to be stored in the index buffer.
        Returns:
        The ID of the index buffer VBO.

      • createInterleavedInstancedVBO

        public int createInterleavedInstancedVBO(int vaoID,
                                         int maxVertexCount,
                                         int startingAttribute,
                                         int... lengths)
        Creates an VBO for storing interleaved data and links it with the attribute lists of a VAO.
        Parameters:
        vaoID - The ID of the VAO to which the VBO should be added.
        maxVertexCount - The maximum number of vertices that would need to be stored in the VBO.
        startingAttribute - The first available attribute list of the VAO.
        lengths - The lengths in floats of each of the data elements associated with any given vertex.
        Returns:
        The ID of the newly created VBO.

      • createEmptyInterleavedVBO

        public int createEmptyInterleavedVBO(int vaoID,
                                     int maxInstanceCount,
                                     int startingAttribute,
                                     int... lengths)
        Creates an empty VBO for storing interleaved data and links it with the attribute lists of a VAO.
        Parameters:
        vaoID - The ID of the VAO to which the VBO should be added.
        maxInstanceCount - The maximum number of vertices that would need to be stored in the VBO.
        startingAttribute - The first available attribute list of the VAO.
        lengths - The lengths in floats of each of the data elements associated with any given vertex.
        Returns:
        The ID of the newly created VBO.

      • addInstancedAttribute

        public void addInstancedAttribute(int vao,
                                  int vbo,
                                  int attribute,
                                  int dataSize,
                                  int instancedDataLength,
                                  int offset)
        Adds a instances attribute to a VBO.
        Parameters:
        vao - The VBO's VAO.
        vbo - The VBO.
        attribute - The attribute to add data to.
        dataSize - The size of data to add.
        instancedDataLength - The length of data to allocate.
        offset - The offset between data.

      • storeDataInVBO

        public void storeDataInVBO(int vbo,
                           java.nio.FloatBuffer buffer,
                           float[] data,
                           int startIndex)
        Store float data into part of a VBO. Can be used for updating data in a VBO.
        Parameters:
        vbo - The ID of the VBO.
        buffer - A float buffer that can be used to store the data in the VBO. Must be bigger than data.length.
        data - The float data to be stored in the VBO.
        startIndex - The starting index in terms of floats for where the data should be stored in the VBO.

      • storeDataInVBO

        public int storeDataInVBO(int vaoID,
                          float[] data,
                          int attributeNumber,
                          int coordSize)
        Stores a float array of data into a FBO.
        Parameters:
        vaoID - The VAO to create a new FBO in.
        data - The data to store.
        attributeNumber - The attribute to create the FBO under.
        coordSize - The size of data being store.
        Returns:
        The new FBO's ID.

      • updateVBO

        public void updateVBO(int vbo,
                      float[] data,
                      java.nio.FloatBuffer buffer)
        Updates a FBO with a new set of data.
        Parameters:
        vbo - The FBO to update.
        data - The data to add into the FBO.
        buffer - A buffer to use to store the data in.

      • refillVBOWithData

        public void refillVBOWithData(int vbo,
                              java.nio.FloatBuffer buffer,
                              float[] data)
        Refills an entire VBO with new data.
        Parameters:
        vbo - The ID of the VBO.
        buffer - A float buffer big enough to contain the data.
        data - The data to be stored in the VBO.

      • interleaveFloatData

        public float[] interleaveFloatData(int count,
                                   float[]... data)
        Interleaved multiple float arrays of data into one interleaved float array.
        Parameters:
        count - The number of data elements (not floats) in the arrays.
        data - The arrays of un-interleaved data.
        Returns:
        The interleaved data.
